data.title: Only 3 ft away
data.text:
First off, a bottle of water was only 2 dollars which quite cheap compared to other places I have been.  The stage is definitely smaller in depth, consequentially the band is right in front of you!!!  The staff was friendly, and even though my name was not on the list for will call, I had my receipt for a ticket and they sorted it out right away.  
No parking at the venue, but I found 3$ parking ~5 mins away, so I can't really complain.  Overall great concert, I hope Amon Amarth comes back again to here!

data.title: Nice
data.text: Both sides of the venue are good for live music. I've seen many shows there in the past and will continue to do so.

data.title: Up close and personal.
data.text: Neat venue where you can get up close to your favorite bands.  Parking was a little difficult on narrow cobble stone streets, and getting out was tough as a nightclub next door was just getting into full swing and there were people all over the place.

data.title: great place for a show
data.text: I went for a show last night.  It was packed but I enjoyed it.  Friendly staff, only thing I did not like was parking down the street but other then that I enjoy it.  Was not a bad section of the stage from all over. I did not get a chance to go upstairs as that was for VIP but I bet it was amazing view of the stage.  I will go hear again for a show.

data.title: Solid venue
data.text: I found this to be a very good concert venue. A perfect small venue; large enough to actually feel like a concert venue and not just a bar. They have two stages, one is smaller for warm up acts and then a main stage. The sound was nothing amazing, but I didn't find anything to complain about either. For anyone visiting Rochester, this is definitely one of the top spots to see some music. Also, it's located downtown, which is always a plus for me.

data.title: A bit rustic but attended a few great fun concerts
data.text: Get in the spirit.. country line dance, hear the 60s sounds, genres of music change frequently it's just on the way-up, small specialty bands .. watch their schedule. small venue, can get jammed but you're up close and personal and audience is part of the experience ... usually stand up only, we like the balcony, decent sound system but acoustics could be better. Ladies Room is a bit of a challenge, has limited bar choices, beer the popular drink of choice, and parking can be a MAJOR issue and you'll pay to park... go early

data.title: Water St is crowded but fun
data.text: Ive seen so many great bands here and show are always fun. The space can get crowded but that makes it a little better because you can get so close to the stage and you can see from basiaclly everywhere. The ticket prices arent that bad either.

data.title: Best Valentine's Day EVER!
data.text: As Steve Burton of Port Chuck proclaimed when he saw me at the VIP meet/greet after Port Chuck's show there on Valentine's Day, "Laurie, you're CRAZY!"  I did think I was a little crazy to have chosen to come to Rochester, from Southern California, in the dead of Winter just to see my favorite band, Port Chuck, but now that I've seen/heard them at Water Street Music Hall, I'd brave the cold again in a heartbeat!  Water Street Music Hall has THE BEST acoustics of anywhere I've seen/heard Port Chuck & a well organized VIP meet/greet afterward!

data.title: Small with less than adequate sound
data.text: More of a bar than a music hall. Small name bands, mostly rock--younger clientele the majority of time (early twenties) There is a nice downtown location. Chances are you will be paying to park and there is generally an entrance fee.

data.title: Urban Music Venue
data.text: This converted historic warehouse is a decent venue for musical acts where there are 500-800 expected attendees.  That would be bigger than a standard bar but too small for the Auditorium Theatre or War Memorial.   A wide variety of music styles are represented with live music several nights a week - note that they are ONLY open for concert events.  There is a long bar with a modest selection, but it is certainly NOT an upscale "club" atmosphere.  Pricing and music quality are up to the individual promoters and acts using the space.  We enjoyed the 480East jazz concert we attended.
